verses.kjv: Likewise this is the law of the trespass offering: it is most holy.
verses.web: “ ‘This is the law of the trespass offering: It is most holy.
verses.ct: These are the instructions for the guilt offering. It is most holy.

verses.kjv: In the place where they kill the burnt offering shall they kill the trespass offering: and the blood thereof shall he sprinkle round about upon the altar.
verses.web: In the place where they kill the burnt offering, he shall kill the trespass offering; and its blood he shall sprinkle around on the altar.
verses.ct: The guilt offering must be slaughtered in the same place where the burnt offering is killed. The priest will then sprinkle its blood on all sides of the altar.

verses.kjv: And he shall offer of it all the fat thereof; the rump, and the fat that covereth the inwards,
verses.web: He shall offer all of its fat: the fat tail, and the fat that covers the innards,
verses.ct: The priest must offer all of the animal's fat: the fat tail, the fat covering the internal organs,

verses.kjv: And the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the flanks, and the caul that is above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away:
verses.web: and he shall take away the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys;
verses.ct: the 2 kidneys with the fat around them near the loins, and the covering on the liver, which he will remove along with the kidneys.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall burn them upon the altar for an offering made by fire unto the LORD: it is a trespass offering.
verses.web: and the priest shall burn them on the altar for an offering made by fire to LORD: it is a trespass offering.
verses.ct: The priest will burn all of this on the altar as a fire offering to the LORD. It is a guilt offering.

verses.kjv: Every male among the priests shall eat thereof: it shall be eaten in the holy place: it is most holy.
verses.web: Every male among the priests may eat of it. It shall be eaten in a holy place. It is most holy.
verses.ct: Any male among the priests may eat from it, but it must be eaten in a holy place. It is most holy.

verses.kjv: As the sin offering is, so is the trespass offering: there is one law for them: the priest that maketh atonement therewith shall have it.
verses.web: “ ‘As is the sin offering, so is the trespass offering; there is one law for them. The priest who makes atonement with them shall have it.
verses.ct: The guilt offering follows the same rules as the sin offering — one set of instructions applies to both. The priest who performs the atonement gets to keep the meat.

verses.kjv: And the priest that offereth any man’s burnt offering, even the priest shall have to himself the skin of the burnt offering which he hath offered.
verses.web: The priest who offers any man’s burnt offering shall have for himself the skin of the burnt offering which he has offered.
verses.ct: When a priest offers someone's burnt offering, he may keep the hide of that animal for himself.

verses.kjv: And all the meat offering that is baken in the oven, and all that is dressed in the fryingpan, and in the pan, shall be the priest’s that offereth it.
verses.web: Every meal offering that is baked in the oven, and all that is prepared in the pan and on the griddle, shall be the priest’s who offers it.
verses.ct: Every grain offering that is baked in an oven, cooked in a pan, or prepared on a griddle belongs to the priest who offers it.

verses.kjv: And every meat offering, mingled with oil, and dry, shall all the sons of Aaron have, one as much as another.
verses.web: Every meal offering, mixed with oil or dry, belongs to all the sons of Aaron, one as well as another.
verses.ct: But every grain offering — whether mixed with oil or dry — belongs equally to all of Aaron's sons, shared among them.

verses.kjv: And this is the law of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which he shall offer unto the LORD.
verses.web: “ ‘This is the law of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which one shall offer to LORD:
verses.ct: These are the instructions for the peace offering presented to the LORD.

verses.kjv: If he offer it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour, fried.
verses.web: If he offers it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and cakes mixed with oil.
verses.ct: If someone offers it as an expression of thanksgiving, he must also bring unleavened cakes mixed with oil, unleavened wafers spread with oil, and fine flour cakes fried in oil.

verses.kjv: Besides the cakes, he shall offer for his offering leavened bread with the sacrifice of thanksgiving of his peace offerings.
verses.web: He shall offer his offering with the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving with cakes of leavened bread.
verses.ct: Along with these cakes, he must also include loaves of leavened bread as part of his thanksgiving peace offering.

verses.kjv: And of it he shall offer one out of the whole oblation for an heave offering unto the LORD, and it shall be the priest’s that sprinkleth the blood of the peace offerings.
verses.web: Of it he shall offer one out of each offering for a heave offering to LORD. It shall be the priest’s who sprinkles the blood of the peace offerings.
verses.ct: From each type of bread, he must set aside one portion as a special contribution to the LORD. That portion goes to the priest who sprinkles the blood of the peace offering.

verses.kjv: And the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten the same day that it is offered; he shall not leave any of it until the morning.
verses.web: The flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten on the day of his offering. He shall not leave any of it until the morning.
verses.ct: The meat from a thanksgiving peace offering must be eaten on the same day it is offered. None of it may be left until morning.

verses.kjv: But if the sacrifice of his offering be a vow, or a voluntary offering, it shall be eaten the same day that he offereth his sacrifice: and on the morrow also the remainder of it shall be eaten:
verses.web: “ ‘But if the sacrifice of his offering is a vow, or a free will offering, it shall be eaten on the day that he offers his sacrifice. On the next day what remains of it shall be eaten,
verses.ct: However, if the offering is given to fulfill a vow or as a voluntary gift, it should be eaten on the day it is offered, but whatever is left over may also be eaten the next day.

verses.kjv: But the remainder of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burnt with fire.
verses.web: but what remains of the meat of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burned with fire.
verses.ct: Any meat still remaining on the 3rd day must be burned up completely.

verses.kjv: And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings be eaten at all on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed unto him that offereth it: it shall be an abomination, and the soul that eateth of it shall bear his iniquity.
verses.web: If any of the meat of the sacrifice of his peace offerings is eaten on the third day, it will not be accepted, and it shall not be credited to him who offers it. It will be an abomination, and the soul who eats any of it will bear his iniquity.
verses.ct: If any meat from a peace offering is eaten on the 3rd day, the offering will not be accepted. It won't count for the person who brought it — it will be considered disgusting. Anyone who eats it will bear the guilt of that sin.

verses.kjv: And the flesh that toucheth any unclean thing shall not be eaten; it shall be burnt with fire: and as for the flesh, all that be clean shall eat thereof.
verses.web: “ ‘The meat that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten. It shall be burned with fire. As for the meat, everyone who is clean may eat it;
verses.ct: Any meat that touches something unclean must not be eaten — it must be burned. As for the rest of the meat, anyone who is ceremonially clean may eat it.

verses.kjv: But the soul that eateth of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, that pertain unto the LORD, having his uncleanness upon him, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.
verses.web: but the soul who eats of the meat of the sacrifice of peace offerings that belongs to LORD, having his uncleanness on him, that soul shall be cut off from his people.
verses.ct: But if anyone eats meat from a peace offering belonging to the LORD while they are ceremonially unclean, that person must be cut off from their people.

verses.kjv: Moreover the soul that shall touch any unclean thing, as the uncleanness of man, or any unclean beast, or any abominable unclean thing, and eat of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which pertain unto the LORD, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.
verses.web: When anyone touches any unclean thing, the uncleanness of man, or an unclean animal, or any unclean abomination, and eats some of the meat of the sacrifice of peace offerings which belong to LORD, that soul shall be cut off from his people.’ ”
verses.ct: If anyone touches something unclean — whether human uncleanness, an unclean animal, or any other disgusting unclean thing — and then eats meat from a peace offering belonging to the LORD, that person must be cut off from their people.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, Ye shall eat no manner of fat, of ox, or of sheep, or of goat.
verses.web: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘You shall eat no fat, of bull, or sheep, or goat.
verses.ct: "Tell the people of Israel: You must not eat the fat of an ox, a sheep, or a goat.

verses.kjv: And the fat of the beast that dieth of itself, and the fat of that which is torn with beasts, may be used in any other use: but ye shall in no wise eat of it.
verses.web: The fat of that which dies of itself, and the fat of that which is torn of animals, may be used for any other service, but you shall in no way eat of it.
verses.ct: The fat from an animal that dies on its own or is killed by wild animals may be used for other purposes, but you must never eat it.

verses.kjv: For whosoever eateth the fat of the beast, of which men offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD, even the soul that eateth it shall be cut off from his people.
verses.web: For whoever eats the fat of the animal which men offer as an offering made by fire to LORD, even the soul who eats it shall be cut off from his people.
verses.ct: Anyone who eats the fat from an animal that is offered as a fire offering to the LORD must be cut off from their people.

verses.kjv: Moreover ye shall eat no manner of blood, whether it be of fowl or of beast, in any of your dwellings.
verses.web: You shall not eat any blood, whether it is of bird or of animal, in any of your dwellings.
verses.ct: You must never eat any blood, whether from a bird or an animal, no matter where you live.

verses.kjv: Whatsoever soul it be that eateth any manner of blood, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.
verses.web: Whoever it is who eats any blood, that soul shall be cut off from his people.’ ”
verses.ct: Anyone who eats any blood at all must be cut off from their people."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, He that offereth the sacrifice of his peace offerings unto the LORD shall bring his oblation unto the LORD of the sacrifice of his peace offerings.
verses.web: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘He who offers the sacrifice of his peace offerings to LORD shall bring his offering to LORD out of the sacrifice of his peace offerings.
verses.ct: "Tell the people of Israel: Anyone who brings a peace offering to the LORD must personally present part of it as their gift to the LORD.

verses.kjv: His own hands shall bring the offerings of the LORD made by fire, the fat with the breast, it shall he bring, that the breast may be waved for a wave offering before the LORD.
verses.web: With his own hands he shall bring the offerings of LORD made by fire. He shall bring the fat with the breast, that the breast may be waved for a wave offering before LORD.
verses.ct: With their own hands they must bring the fire offerings to the LORD. They must bring the fat along with the breast, and the breast will be waved before the LORD as a wave offering.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall burn the fat upon the altar: but the breast shall be Aaron’s and his sons’.
verses.web: The priest shall burn the fat on the altar, but the breast shall be Aaron’s and his sons’.
verses.ct: The priest will burn the fat on the altar, but the breast belongs to Aaron and his sons.

verses.kjv: And the right shoulder shall ye give unto the priest for an heave offering of the sacrifices of your peace offerings.
verses.web: The right thigh you shall give to the priest for a heave offering out of the sacrifices of your peace offerings.
verses.ct: You must also give the right thigh to the priest as a special contribution from your peace offerings.

verses.kjv: He among the sons of Aaron, that offereth the blood of the peace offerings, and the fat, shall have the right shoulder for his part.
verses.web: He among the sons of Aaron who offers the blood of the peace offerings, and the fat, shall have the right thigh for a portion.
verses.ct: Whichever son of Aaron offers the blood and fat of the peace offering gets the right thigh as his portion.

verses.kjv: For the wave breast and the heave shoulder have I taken of the children of Israel from off the sacrifices of their peace offerings, and have given them unto Aaron the priest and unto his sons by a statute for ever from among the children of Israel.
verses.web: For the waved breast and the heaved thigh I have taken from the children of Israel out of the sacrifices of their peace offerings, and have given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons as their portion forever from the children of Israel.’ ”
verses.ct: I have taken the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the special contribution from the Israelites' peace offerings, and I have given them permanently to Aaron the priest and his sons. This is their rightful share from the people of Israel forever."

verses.kjv: This is the portion of the anointing of Aaron, and of the anointing of his sons, out of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, in the day when he presented them to minister unto the LORD in the priest’s office;
verses.web: This is the consecrated portion of Aaron, and the consecrated portion of his sons, out of the offerings of LORD made by fire, in the day when he presented them to minister to LORD in the priest’s office;
verses.ct: This is the portion set apart from the LORD's fire offerings for Aaron and his sons, assigned to them on the day they were presented to serve the LORD as priests.

verses.kjv: Which the LORD commanded to be given them of the children of Israel, in the day that he anointed them, by a statute for ever throughout their generations.
verses.web: which LORD commanded to be given them of the children of Israel, in the day that he anointed them. It is their portion forever throughout their generations.
verses.ct: The LORD commanded that the Israelites give this to them on the day he anointed them. It is their permanent share throughout every generation.

verses.kjv: This is the law of the burnt offering, of the meat offering, and of the sin offering, and of the trespass offering, and of the consecrations, and of the sacrifice of the peace offerings;
verses.web: This is the law of the burnt offering, the meal offering, the sin offering, the trespass offering, the consecration, and the sacrifice of peace offerings
verses.ct: These are the complete instructions for the burnt offering, the grain offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the ordination offering, and the peace offering —

verses.kjv: Which the LORD commanded Moses in mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to offer their oblations unto the LORD, in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.web: which LORD commanded Moses in Mount Sinai in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to offer their offerings to LORD, in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.ct: which the LORD gave to Moses on Mount Sinai, on the day he commanded the people of Israel to present their offerings to the LORD in the wilderness of Sinai.
